_comment: GENERAL NOTE: optional arguments should be left in, as the runner does not check whether a param is required for a model and may cause an interrupt.
define the model: either sacramento2018 (interneuron dendritic MC) or errormc
define the model for teacher: either sacramento2018 (interneuron dendritic MC), errormc or ann
all times below are in milliseconds
below only relevant for PAL
dataset_size: how many samples to present
time (in ms) for pre-training to settle voltages
Number of error neurons. In keeping in line with 'layers', this has the same shape -- so the first entry will be ignored (!)
implemented activations: logistic, hard_sigmoid, relu, soft_relu, linear, tanh
implemented models: BP, FA or PAL
noise level in setting transpose weights (BP only)
PAL: noise type: white noise held or OU
PAL: sampled noise is rescaled by noise_scale
PAL and uP_adaptive-only: noise_deg is the angle of alignment between uP_breve_i and BPP_iL * rP_breve_L below which no noise is injected
i.e. we are satisfied with this amount of alignment
PAL: implemented modes: uP (scale noise with uP), vapi (scale noise with vapi) and uP_adaptive (scale noise with uP and angle of alignment)
whether to use the voltage (sacramento2018) or rate (errormc) as target
errormc only: whether to start lateral weights as identity matrix
weights are initialised as numpy.random.uniform with range defined below. WIP and BPI are overridden by init_in_SPS=True
FA and PAL only: range of BPP
lateral weight inits for student. errormc: this is added to to the identity, if enabled
weight inits for teacher
lateral weight inits for teacher. errormc: this is added to to the identity, if enabled
errormc only: whether to use skip forward connections ('skip' or 'layered')
errormc only: range for skip connections in WPP
errormc only: whether to use skip backward connections ('skip' or 'layered')
errormc only: range for skip connections in BII
noise on activation function slope (normal sampling about 1.0)
PAL only: alpha is the scaling factor of the regularizer
array of seeds
whether to set *the* self-predicting state during initialisation
PAL only: low-pass on interneuron
PAL only: high-pass on output layer pyramidal neurons
PAL only: low-pass on updates of WPP
PAL only: whether to apply regularizer only if rP_breve > 0
whether to use activations in dWPP -- standard: true
errormc only: whether to send phi' to error units
input signal, possibilites: step
copy the weights and voltages of teacher at init (for testing)
